data.title: Jefferson-Madison Regional Library
data.text:
Northside Library

The Drive Up window is open from 10 am until 30 minutes before the branch closes (8:30pm Mon-Thu, 4:30pm Fri-Sat) Hey adults! Love board games? Check the calendar for Grown-Up Game Nights. An anime club for adults? We have one! Check the calendar for dates. Conversation Circle is an opportunity for individuals for whom English is their second language to practice their conversational skills. The Art Wall in the lobby is available free of charge to artists who want to display their work. Northside Library is located in the former Phillips Building Supply structure which was renovated to serve as both the library and a County warehouse (on separate floors). — Read more about the branch.

Address

705 Rio Road West

Charlottesville, VA 22901

Hours

Using the Branch

Wednesday: 10:00 am - 8:30 pm

Thursday: 10:00 am - 8:30 pm

Friday: 10:00 am - 4:30 pm

Saturday: 10:00 am - 4:30 pm

Drive Up Services:

Holds checkout (select Northside Drive Up as the hold location)

Pay fines with exact change, check, or card.

Branch Closings

Programs Today See all programs...

Special Programs at Northside

Book Scavenger Hunt at the Botanical Garden of the Piedmont!

Mon, 08/19/2024 - Sat, 09/21/2024

Calling all adventurers and book lovers! The library is thrilled to invite you to a unique and enchanting experience: a Scavenger Hunt for mini works of art in the form of book covers, hidden within the beautiful Botanical Garden of the Piedmont (BGP). This special event is hosted in honor of the BGP’s upcoming Botanical Art Festival, celebrating the intricate beauty and creativity found in both art and nature

Read more in the blog post.

In the Quiet Room: Emmanuel Ndenguebi-Essimi

Contact Info:

Email - kloppvk@gmail.com

Text - Cell

Art @ Northside: Cary Golberg

Services at Northside

3D Printing

Send 3D print files for printing, $0.10 per gram.

Adult Literacy/ELL Collection

Stories, bilingual dictionaries, language instruction, audiobooks, and DVDs

Charging Stations

Charge your devices via usb ports.

Chromebooks

All branches have Chromebooks available to be used in the library.

Coding Station

A Raspberry Pi with several IDEs and other programming resources

Computers

Use JMRL computers for job searching, homework or to get online

Conference Rooms

Book a room for 1-4 people

Faxing

Faxing is available at $1 for each page, including any cover pages, within the United States.

Maker Lab

Tools and equipment to create.

Meeting Rooms

Free community meeting spaces

Notary Services

Make an appointment with a notary at any JMRL branch.

Printing and Photocopying

$.10 black and white, $.50 color. Print from your own device with Wireless Printing.

Proctoring

Make an appointment with a librarian at a JMRL branch for test proctoring

Quiet Room

A comfortable reading room available to everyone where talking or noise is prohibited.

Sewing Machines

Sewing machines are available for use in sewing projects (must bring own materials).

Teen Maker Lab

For ages 11-18 only Want to learn about a new craft or skill? The Teen Maker Lab provides a space for trying new things on a rotating basis

Tutorials

Get computer assistance

Wi-Fi

Use Wi-Fi at all JMRL branches
